titles.title: Chief Manufacturing Officer Act

To establish the United States Chief Manufacturing Officer in the Executive Office of the President with the responsibility of developing a national manufacturing strategy to revitalize the manufacturing sector, spur economic growth, and expand United States competitiveness, and for other purposes.
Chief Manufacturing Officer Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.summary:
Chief Manufacturing Officer Act
This bill expresses the sense of Congress that a well-designed national manufacturing strategy would benefit the U.S. economy.
The President shall appoint a United States Chief Manufacturing Officer whose primary duty is to develop the national manufacturing strategy using the criteria set forth in this bill.
The bill amends the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010 to designate the United States Chief Manufacturing Officer as the chair of the Committee on Technology under the National Science and Technology Council.
